result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony M Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony M Johnson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Anthony M Johnson was found guilty of Possess w/Intent to Deliver Heroin (<=3g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, 2nd/Sub. Drug Off.-Class E/F/G/H/I Fel.], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:  all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA; all applicable fees of supervision.
Court ordered that all court costs, fines and surcharges be paid through collection from any Court ordered obligations from the defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain or maintain full time employment.

No possession, consumption, selling or distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
No possession of drug delivery property: corner cuts, scales, syringes, multiple cell phones, etc.
No contact with any known drug users or locations where illegal substances are trafficked or consumed.
No contact with the codefendant Jasmine Pantoja except for childcare purposes.

Comply with any other programs designated by the Department.
Follow all rules of supervision  and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the Department.
AODA assewssment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights  have been restored.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony M Johnson

records.addlTxt: Defendant deceased. er

Defendant Anthony M Johnson not in court.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.
Proof of death notification received from DOC
Received & Filed, Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (19 pages) commencing 03-16-2018 by RISA KRAMER.

Defendant Anthony M Johnson in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Anthony M Johnson in custody.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the Defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 60 MONTHS, with 177 DAYS credit.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 24 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 36 MONTHS.

Court finds Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the Probation Department.
Maintain ABSOLUTE sobriety.
No possession, consumption, selling, or distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
Random urine screens.
No possession of drug delivery property (corner cuts, scales, syringes, multiple cell phones, etc).
No contact with any known drug users or locations where illegal substances are trafficked or consumed. 
No contact with the co-defendant, Jasmine Pantoja, EXCEPT for childcare purposes. 
Obtain or maintain full-time employment.
Comply with any other programs designated by the Department.
Provide a DNA sample.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the Department.

Court ordered the Defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
Court ordered that all court costs, fines, and surcharges be paid through collection from any court ordered obligations from the Defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised Defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised Defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised Defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

20 day appeal rights given.

Filed: Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, and PreTrial Incarceration Credit. 
Previously Filed: Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Court is in receipt of Defense motion to adjourn. State does not object. Court grants request. Sentence date of March 2, 2018 at 8:30am is vacated. Court ordered matter calendared for Sentencing Hearing on March 16, 2018 at 8:30am. Case remains calendared in Branch 24.
Defendant's Motion to Adjourn Sentencing Hearing, received and filed.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Anthony M Johnson in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 2: Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm, ammunition or body armor. Court advised defendant that his/her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights are restored.

AS TO COUNT 1:   Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 2, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Calvin R Malone in court, defendant Anthony M Johnson not in court, in custody.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.
Held off the record. Case in Court for Status Conference. Defense requests Projected Guilty Plea hearing date. Case remains calendared in Branch 24.

Defendant Anthony M Johnson in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Anthony M Johnson in custody.  Daniel Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SES.
BRANCH 28 FOR 24. Matter scheduled for Final Pretrial. Defense moved to withdraw as counsel. Colloquy held. Defense withdrew motion to withdraw.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court vacates speedy trial demand and jury trial date. Defense requested matter set for status of counsel in Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for January 2, 2018 at 08:30 am.
Motion to Wtihdraw as Attorney of Record, received and filed.

Attorney Calvin R Malone in court, defendant Anthony M Johnson not in court, in custody.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Held off the record. Case in court for Final Pretrial, however Branch 24 is in jury trial for today's proceedings, case adjourned. Case remains calendared in Branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 29, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motion in Limine, received and filed.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions, received and filed.

Defendant Anthony M Johnson in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Anthony M Johnson in custody.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in Court at Court's request. Court is in receipt of letter from Defendant received on November 1, 2017. Colloquy held with the Defense.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Speedy Trial demand is to expire on February 8, 2018. Court ordered Final Pretrial date and Jury Trial date, vacated and rescheduled. Case proceeded to bail/bond hearing at Defense request. Letter from Defendant, received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia and no alcohol. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

BRANCH 11 FOR BRANCH 24. ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE. Attorney Melissa Nepomiachi in court, defendant Anthony M Johnson not in court, in custody.  Katherine Seelow for Daniel Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AS. Defendants appearance waived for todays proceedings. Case calendared for return on bench warrant. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 2pm today.  If defendant does not appear before 2pm bench warrant will be issued and bail forfeited. For reasons stated on the record, the Court GRANTS the State's motion to adjourn the jury trial.  Jury trial date of 03/28/2016 at 8:30am is vacated, but defendant to check in to receive the new date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Jury trial scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Anthony M Johnson in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.      Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered Count 2 amended to Possession with Intent to Deliver Controlled Substance (Heroin) (3 grams or less)- PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Second and Subsequent Offense, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 961.41(1m)(d)1, 939.50(3)(f), 939.05 and 961.48(1)(b), a Class F Felony.  Jury trial scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case is reassigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03 due to the assignment of the Assistant District Attorney and the charges in this criminal complaint.  Case is adjourned to Branch 03.  Arraignment scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 06-11-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony M Johnson in court with Attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Joy Hammond, appearing for Dennis Murphy, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State informs Court their witnesses did not appear in court; to the best of their knowledge subpoenas were not issued for the witnesses.  State requests adjournment of today's scheduled preliminary hearing.

Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
Clerk:  jms

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, or any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Anthony M Johnson in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
State moves to remove documents unrelated to this case from the court files. GRANTED.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. 

AS TO COUNT 2:
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings, EXCEPT FOR THE USE OF A DANGEROUS WEAPON ENHANCER. COURT DISMISSES THE ENHANCER ON THIS COUNT.

AS TO COUNT 3:
COURT DOES NOT FIND PROBABLE CAUSE. COUNT IS DISMISSED ON ORDER OF THE COURT.

Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
